availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, printer. Louisville native. Married to Josephine E. Stutsman Lynch in Jefferson County on May 6, 1849. Father of Monroe Lynch, Raymond Bell Lynch, George J. Lynch, Mary A Lynch, Belle Lynch, and Florence Lynch. Louisville printer in 1850. Louisville resident in 1863. Printer for the Louisville Journal and the Louisville Courier-Journal. Member of the Louisville Printers' Society. Member of the Louisville Typographical Union, No. 10.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 8, p. 396B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 12, p. 592A.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Enumeraction District 141, p. 176C.
Find A Grave, "Josephine Stutsman Lynch (unknown-1898)," Memorial 171352256, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/171352256 (accessed December 4, 2019).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000819613, p. 220 of microfilm.
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport – Microfilm (before 1911), KDLA, Frankfort, Kentucky, Roll 7007129: Jefferson County, Books 9-11, p. 451.
“Pay Tribute to Memory of Raymond B. Lynch, Pioneer Louisville Printer,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), March 12, 1911, p. A3.
KYR-0001-004-0133.
